title: Patient-Centered Treatment Course for Medical Professionals Based on Multimodal Microlearning: Integrated Social-Medical Ethics Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical concepts and patient diagnosis processes, intermediate clinical judgment skills, foundational knowledge of medical ethics and patient rights
context.additional_context: Content optimized for smartphone-based learning environments and project-based assessments to strengthen practical skills. Focus is on collaboration within medical systems, improving patient-caregiver relationships, and integrating social responsibility and civic engagement into the learning environment.

learning_goals: Applying patient-centered care approaches, learners can develop case-specific treatment plans adhering to medical protocols, safety standards, and patient rights protection principles.

Using mobile applications, learners can perform self-directed problem-solving learning ≥3 times weekly, incorporate civic engagement feedback via peer reviews, and propose improvements considering medical-societal contexts.

Within two weeks, learners can incorporate ≥3 peer feedbacks into a 5-page improvement report applying medical ethics and patient rights principles (e.g., Helsinki Declaration, informed consent standards), achieve "excellent" ratings in ≥4 out of 5 institutional rubric items, and include strategies for improving patient-provider relationships and fulfilling social responsibilities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
